title: R43859
content: The President appoints individuals to federal government positions, some with Senate confirmation. This report covers nominations for full-time positions in various organizations during the 112th Congress, excluding executive departments and regulatory boards. Tables provide agency-specific information. The report covers nominations for full-time positions in various organizations during the 112th Congress, excluding executive departments and regulatory boards. Information on appointment activity within agencies, including confirmations, rejections, and elapsed time between nomination and confirmation, was compiled using various sources. During the 112th Congress, President Obama submitted 34 nominations for full-time positions in various agencies. 27 were confirmed, 6 were returned, and 1 was withdrawn. One recess appointment was made. The time for Senate confirmation varies widely. During the 112th Congress, President Obama submitted 34 nominations for full-time positions in various agencies. 27 were confirmed, 6 were returned, and 1 was withdrawn. The average number of days elapsed between nomination and confirmation was 142.7, with a median of 112.0 days. Agency profiles in the report include data on full-time PAS positions and appointment actions during the 112th Congress. The report identifies full-time PAS positions in the organization and their pay levels under the Executive Schedule. It also provides information on each nomination, including nominee name, position, dates, and confirmation details. The tables show statistics on the time between nomination and confirmation. The report includes tables with statistics on the time between nomination and confirmation for full-time PAS positions. The tables provide average "days to confirm" in mean and median values, offering more information to assess the central tendency of the data. Table A-1 lists appointment actions alphabetically by appointee's last name, including agency, position title, nomination date, confirmation date, and duration count. Table A-2 includes mean and median values for the days to confirm column. During the 112th Congress, the Presidential Appointments Streamlining and Efficiency Act (P.L. 112-166) eliminated the Senate's advice and consent requirement for 163 federal agency positions. Table A-2 summarizes appointment data by agency type, including confirmations, nominations returned, and mean/median days to confirm. Positions affected by the Act are listed in Appendix B of the report. The report includes a list of agencies and positions affected by the Presidential Appointments Streamlining and Efficiency Act (P.L. 112-166). Appendices provide a summary of all nominations and appointments, positions affected by the Act, and agency abbreviations.
